title: Intellectual Property
definition: intangible property created by an individual or organisation
examples: Names of your products or brands
Design or look of your products
Things you write make or produce
purpose: Protects the creator from others profiting from their hard work without their consent.
Makes it easier to take legal action against anyone who steals or copies it, with an aim of making a profit.
The type of protection you can get depends on your creation
